plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: The common sunflower is a tall annual plant known for its large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun. It is widely cultivated for its seeds and oil and also grows wild in many temperate regions.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers can grow to be over 3 meters tall, and their flower heads consist of thousands of tiny flowers called florets.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical evergreen shrub that produces large, colorful flowers often used in landscaping and gardens in warm climates. Flowers can be single or double and come in a variety of colors.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, prominently blooming in summer
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers only last for a day but bloom continuously during the growing season.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant with dense spikes of pea-like flowers, popular in gardens and wildflower meadows. It enriches soil by fixing nitrogen.
plants.location: North America, introduced in Europe and elsewhere
plants.funFact: Lupines are known for their ability to improve soil fertility through nitrogen fixation.

plants.name: Protea cynaroides
plants.description: This iconic South African shrub produces striking large flower heads resembling artichokes with pink bracts surrounding central florets. Often used in floral arrangements.
plants.funFact: The King Protea is the national flower of South Africa and can live for decades in wild conditions.
